definition: To make a task or situation more challenging or difficult, often resulting in increased effort or obstacles. It is commonly used to describe the act of adding complications or making something harder to accomplish.

examples.german: Die schlechte Sicht erschwert das Autofahren.
examples.english: The poor visibility makes driving difficult.

examples.german: Die hohen Preise erschweren den Zugang zu Bildung.
examples.english: The high prices hinder access to education.

examples.german: Die komplizierte Bedienung erschwert die Nutzung des Ger√§ts.
examples.english: The complicated operation complicates the use of the device.

examples.german: Die steigende Arbeitsbelastung erschwert die Work-Life-Balance.
examples.english: The increasing workload makes work-life balance difficult.
